6LoWPAN (RFC4944)6LowPAN netif implementation
6LoWPAN over BLE (RFC7668)This file implements a RFC7668 implementation for 6LoWPAN over Bluetooth Low Energy
Application layered TCP Introduction

Overview

altcp (application layered TCP connection API; to be used from TCPIP thread) is an abstraction layer that prevents applications linking hard against the tcp.h functions while providing the same functionality
Application layered TCP FunctionsThis file contains the common functions for altcp to work
TLS layerThis file contains function prototypes for a TLS layer
DNSImplements a DNS host name to IP address resolver
Error codes
Ethernet
HTTP client
HTTP serverThis httpd supports for a rudimentary server-side-include facility which will replace tags of the form in any file whose extension is .shtml, .shtm or .ssi with strings provided by an include handler whose pointer is provided to the module via function http_set_ssi_handler()
Options
IANA assigned numbers
IEEE 802.1D bridgeThis file implements an IEEE 802.1D bridge by using a multilayer netif approach (one hardware-independent netif for the bridge that uses hardware netifs for its ports)
FDB example codeThis file implements an example for an FDB (Forwarding DataBase)

Packet buffers (PBUF)Packets are built from the pbuf data structure 


Porting (system abstraction layer)


Compiler/platform abstractionAll defines related to this section must not be placed in lwipopts.h, but in arch/cc.h! If the compiler does not provide memset() this file must include a definition of it, or include a file which defines it 


Critical sectionsUsed to protect short regions of code against concurrent access 


Non-standard functionsLwIP provides default implementations for non-standard functions 


OS abstraction layerNo need to implement functions in this section in NO_SYS mode 


MailboxesMailboxes should be implemented as a queue which allows multiple messages to be posted (implementing as a rendez-vous point where only one message can be posted at a time can have a highly negative impact on performance) 


Misc


MutexesMutexes are recommended to correctly handle priority inversion, especially if you use LWIP_CORE_LOCKING 


SemaphoresSemaphores can be either counting or binary - lwIP works with both kinds 


Performance measurementAll defines related to this section must not be placed in lwipopts.h, but in arch/perf.h! Measurement calls made throughout lwip, these can be defined to nothing 


Time


RAWImplementation of raw protocol PCBs for low-level handling of different types of protocols besides (or overriding) those already available in lwIP 


SLIPThis is an arch independent SLIP netif 


SMTP clientThis is simple SMTP client for raw API

There is also a MIB compiler and a MIB viewer in lwIP contrib repository (lwip-contrib/apps/LwipMibCompiler)
